title.rendered: Mother’s Day: Our Favorite Mom Moments

content.rendered:
In honor of Mother's Day, we wanted to dedicate this blog to all the moms and mother figures out there to show our appreciation. She's a built-in best friend with a love like no other.

We all know it's a day full of extra hugs, bundles of spring flowers, and a trip to the spa, but have you ever wondered how this holiday came to be?

In the U.S., Mother's Day is celebrated on the second Sunday in May. It all began in the early 1900s, thanks to Anna Jarvis. After the loss of her own mother, Jarvis wanted to create a way to honor all of the sacrifices mothers make for their children.

Thanks to Anna's efforts, Mother's Day was added to the national calendar in 1914, and it's now celebrated by millions!

Mothers are often a big part of a couple's wedding planning process and pitch in on the big day to offer a helping hand with last-minute details, advice, and unwavering love and support. We've rounded up our favorite mom moments from our real weddings to celebrate, so scroll on for some extra sweet photos.

Chelsea + Scott

Chelsea and Scott had a chic and romantic summer ceremony and reception at The Bridge Building. Here, Chelsea shared a sweet gift with her mom while some happy tears were shed, and Scott's mom could hardly contain her emotions seeing her son as a groom.

Photos by Hannah Leigh Imagery

Emily Grace + Michael

Emily Grace and Michael began their wedding day with a classic ceremony at the Scarritt Bennett Center, followed by a timeless reception at The Bell Tower. Before all of the festivities began, Emily Grace shared a loving embrace with her mom.

Photos by Madi Flournoy

Kelley + Nate

Kelley and Nate celebrated their nuptials with a spectacular view of the city's downtown fireworks display on the 4th of July in 2019. But sparks weren't the only thing that flew. Nate and his mom gave a show-stopping performance for their mother and son dance.

Photo by  Cody and Allison Photography

Suzanne + Heath

Suzanne and Heath's romantic and modern spring wedding at The Bell Tower was filled with fun and good Southern food. Here, the two had an emotional moment as Suzanne's mom helped with the veil.

Photos by Wynd & Paisley Co.

Megan + Taylor

Before Megan's mom walked her down the aisle for her rustic romantic wedding ceremony, they shared a few laughs and joyous moments together to start off the day.

Photos by Teale Photography

Megan + Scott

Megan and Scott opted for a micro wedding ceremony and reception at the Cannery Ballroom with so many sentimental moments. Scott and his mom shared a sweet laugh during their mother and son dance.

Photos by Hannah Leigh Imagery

Brandice + Marland 

Brandice and Marland's summer wedding day was full of elegance and precious moments—much like this beautifully captured moment between Brandice and her mom.

Photos by John Myers Photography

Blair + Tyler

Blair and Tyler celebrated with a rustic, chic winter wedding at The Bell Tower. To show her appreciation for all they've done for her, Blair gifted her parents this heartfelt illustration that reads, "Everything I am is because of you."

Photos by Glenai Gilbert

Courtney + Ryan

Courtney and Ryan had their ceremony on a sunny summer day at The Bell Tower. Below, Courtney and her mom exchanged some sweet looks while showing off their wedding day attire.

Photos by Molly Peach

excerpt.rendered: In honor of Mother’s Day, we’re looking back at some of our favorite wedding moments with mom.
